Common.remarks:
Each key must consist of the following three parts, seperated by colons, to be dispatched:
Key Part function
prefix
Indicates all resources to be dispatched automatically (prefix = "auto")
ElementID The ID of the child control inside the passed control
Parameter
The parameter can denote a single property or contain prefixes it self.
If the parameter section of the key contains prefixes, the child control must implement IResourceDispatchTarget for the resource to be applied. Dispatch itself can only handle parameters named like one of the child control's properties.
Common.exception: A resource with an ElementID was found, that is unknown in the control's Control collection.
For a control that does not implement IResourceDispatchTarget, Parameter denotes an unknown property.

Dispatch.param: The control to be dispatched. The control must contain child controls for dispatching to occur.

DispatchGeneric.param: A dictonary consisting of name/value pairs corresponding to property's name and value resprectively.
